greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = the number of Dyck paths of semilength n with k UUUU's.
comment: Each of rows 0, 1, 2, 3 has one entry. Row n (n >= 3) has n-2 entries. Row sums yield the Catalan numbers (A000108). Column 0 yields A036765. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 14 2007
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..150, flattened
FindStat - Combinatorial Statistic Finder, The number of occurrences of the contiguous pattern [.,[.,[.,[.,.]]]].
A. Sapounakis, I. Tasoulas and P. Tsikouras, Counting strings in Dyck paths, Discrete Math., 307 (2007), 2909-2924.
formula: G.f.: G=G(t,z) satisfies (1-t)*z^3*G^3 + z*(t+z-t*z)*G^2 + ((1-t)*z-1)*G+1 = 0. - _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 14 2007
example: T(5,1) = 5 because we have UUUUDUDDDD, UUUUDDUDDD, UUUUDDDUDD, UUUUDDDDUD and UDUUUUDDDD.
maple: eq:=(1-t)*z^3*G^3+z*(t+z-t*z)*G^2+((1-t)*z-1)*G+1: g:=RootOf(eq,G): gser:= simplify(series(g,z=0,15)): for n from 0 to 12 do P[n]:=sort(coeff(gser,z,n)) end do: 1;1;2; for n from 3 to 12 do seq(coeff(P[n],t,j),j=0..n-3) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form; # _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 14 2007
b:= proc(x, y, t) option remember; `if`(y<0 or y>x, 0,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, z, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(2*n, 0, 1)):
mathematica: b[x_, y_, t_] := b[x, y, t] = If[y<0 || y>x, 0, If[x == 0, 1, Expand[b[x-1, y+1, Min[t+1, 4]]*If[t == 4, z, 1] + b[x-1, y-1, 1]]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, z, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, z]}]] @ b[2*n, 0, 1]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 28 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 07 2007
